meanings.definition: A group of organisms believed to have evolved from a common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different clades to understand how species are related.
meanings.sent2: The clades of birds show the evolutionary history of feathered creatures.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, we joked that our relatives formed a clade of loud talkers.
meanings.sent4: The clade of artists shared a common inspiration, like branches from the same artistic tree.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, each tree and its surrounding plants form a unique clade of life.

meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the classification of organisms.

meanings.sent2: Clades play a crucial role in organizing the vast array of living organisms.
meanings.sent3: In the library, the section on clades was filled with books on taxonomy and evolution.
